page.title: 05COUNTY EDUCATION:WOKINGHAM
page.content: {St.Sebastian's School} An{aided}school.The buildings are owned and maintained by the{church}who appoint governors to carry the responsibility for repair and upkeep.The{governors}appoint staff and run the school under the leadership of the headteacher. The state pays the staff's salaries and finance teaching equipment.The school provides places for 112 children between the ages of 5 and 11.Hot and cold lunches are prepared in the kitchen,sold cafetaria style. Children choose their own meal or bring a packed lunch,eaten in the hall.There is a tarmac playground, and a copse with an adventure playground. The school has the use of a large playing field adjoining.The vicar visits once a week for a{Christian {assembly}and a{Eucharist}is celebrated twice a term,with parents joining in.
